TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}
TEXT.source: told by Giłgiław of Vałulu village

S.FORM: nu misepi tjen tua tsemdatsedas tua małiałia, nanguaq aravats.
no misepi tjen toa cemdacedas toa maljialjia, nangoaq aravac.
S.TRANSL: When we dream of the rising sun or dawn it is very good.

S.FORM: matu tsemdatsedas a tja varung; tja sipuqimaqimang tua nemanemanga.
mato cemdacedas a tja varong; tja sipoqimaqimang toa nemanemanga.
S.TRANSL: It is as if our hearts were rising. We will have good luck in everything.

S.FORM: nu łemakałakay itjen, uri kisudjuan itjen.
no ljemakaljakay itjen, ori kisodjoan itjen.
S.TRANSL: If women dream they are on a swing, someone is in love with them. (Note: Swinging of the bride is part of the wedding ceremony.)

S.FORM: nu i vavaw itjen tua kavayan, uri putsekeł itjen tua mamazangiłan.
no i vavaw itjen toa kavayan, ori pocekelj itjen toa mamazangiljan.
S.TRANSL: If we are up a bambusa tree, we will marry a chieftain.

S.FORM: nu misepi tjen tua zangaw, uri pupaisu itjen.
no misepi tjen toa zangaw, ori popaiso itjen.
S.TRANSL: When we dream of the leaf for wrapping betel nut, we will be rich.

S.FORM: nu patsun itjen tua kamaya a malulum, uri matu lum a kinakesan nua tja vaqu.
no pacon itjen toa kamaya a malolom, ori mato lom a kinakesan noa tja vaqo.
S.TRANSL: When we see ripe mangoes, our millet will be fully ripened.

S.FORM: nu misepi tjen tua tsiqaw, namaya uta sipuvaquvaqu.
no misepi tjen toa ciqaw, namaya ota sipovaqovaqo.
S.TRANSL: When we dream about fish, this is also about our millet crop.

S.FORM: nu kakeḍikeḍian a tsiqaw, uri kakeḍikeḍian uta a tja vaqu.
no kakedrikedrian a ciqaw, ori kakedrikedrian ota a tja vaqo.
S.TRANSL: If the fish are small ones, our millet also will have small grains.

S.FORM: nu itua łimełimek a tsiqaw, uri putsemel aravats a tja puvaquan.
no itoa ljimeljimek a ciqaw, ori pocemel aravac a tja povaqoan.
S.TRANSL: If the fish are in muddy water, there will be a lot of weeds in our millet fields.

S.FORM: nu matsatsay, nanguaq aravats, sika merakarakats.
no macacay, nangoaq aravac, sika merakarakac.
S.TRANSL: If there is death or a funeral it is very good; the person seen will be strong.

S.FORM: nu sevatsavatsaq a załum i tjumaq, sipulamilami aya.
no sevacavacaq a zaljom i tjomaq, sipolamilami aya.
S.TRANSL: If water is coming out indoors, it means there will be plenty of staple foods.

S.FORM: nu misepi tjen tua qatsang tua qatjuvi tua nemanemanga a kakeḍikeḍian, tja ałak a penułat.
no misepi tjen toa qacang toa qatjovi toa nemanemanga a kakedrikedrian, tja aljak a penoljat.
S.TRANSL: If we dream about small pigs or snakes or anything, it’s all to do with our children.

S.FORM: łakua nu kakuḍakuḍalan, nakuya tsemas.
ljakoa no kakodrakodralan, nakoya cemas.
S.TRANSL: But if they are big ones, it refers to evil spirits.

S.FORM: nu tsemułutsułu itjen tua qatsang tua qemuzimuzip, uri izua matsay tjanuitjen a tatsekełan.
no cemoljocoljo itjen toa qacang toa qemozimozip, ori izoa macay tjanoitjen a tacekeljan.
S.TRANSL: If we are butchering a pig or other animal, there will be a death in our family.

S.FORM: nu maqevuqevutj a sapuy a tja djinadjas, uri kemalavut itjen tua nasi nua tsautsau.
no maqevoqevotj a sapoy a tja djinadjas, ori kemalavot itjen toa nasi noa caocao.
S.TRANSL: If a flame we are holding is going out, we will be responsible for the death of someone(?).

S.FORM: nu patsutsun itjen sakamaya, uri sełavak itjen tua masunasinasi.
no pacocon itjen sakamaya, ori seljavak itjen toa masonasinasi.
S.TRANSL: If we just see this, we will be present at a death.

S.FORM: nu qezemezemetj nu masulesulem, uri matu qezemezemetj a tja varung tua tja kininemneman.
no qezemezemetj no masolesolem, ori mato qezemezemetj a tja varong toa tja kininemneman.
S.TRANSL: If it is night or getting dark, the thoughts of our hearts will be like night.

S.FORM: nu izua vaqu i tjanuitjen, izua uri matsay.
no izoa vaqo i tjanoitjen, izoa ori macay.
S.TRANSL: If we have millet, there will be a death.

S.FORM: nu izua qemaluqalu tua tsinqadjan, uri izua matsay i djalan.
no izoa qemaloqalo toa cinqadjan, ori izoa macay i djalan.
S.TRANSL: If someone is carrying cut planks of wood, someone will die on a track.

S.FORM: nu misepi tjen tu kemakan itjen tua vutjuł tua qavay, sika saqetjuqetju aya.
no misepi tjen to kemakan itjen toa votjolj toa qavay, sika saqetjoqetjo aya.
S.TRANSL: If we dream that we are eating meat or millet dumplings, it is said to be a sign of illness.

S.FORM: nu keman itjen tua sutjaw tua łuału tua paday, siqesaqesang.
no keman itjen toa sotjaw toa ljoaljo toa paday, siqesaqesang.
S.TRANSL: If we are eating peanuts, sweets or rice, it’s a sign of a cough.

S.FORM: nu seman umaumaq itjen, izua uri matsay a sisan luvang tjanuitjen.
no seman omaomaq itjen, izoa ori macay a sisan lovang tjanoitjen.
S.TRANSL: If we are repairing a house, someone will die and we will have to dig a grave (or a grave will be dug for us).

S.FORM: nu mulaulaw itjen tua tja turivetsan, sipatsatsay nua tja ałak.
no molaolaw itjen toa tja torivecan, sipacacay noa tja aljak.
S.TRANSL: If we have lost our tool, our child will die.

S.FORM: nu vaivaik itjen a sema tjuqała, nakuya; sivaivaik nua tja avavak.
no vaivaik itjen a sema tjoqalja, nakoya; sivaivaik noa tja avavak.
S.TRANSL: If we are going to another village, that is bad; our souls will depart.

S.FORM: nu venliveli tjen tua makaliław, kapułu aya.
no venliveli tjen toa makaliljaw, kapoljo aya.
S.TRANSL: If we are buying cloth, it is a sign of mourning.

S.FORM: nu namitung itjen tua kaḍaḍi.
no namitong itjen toa kadradri.
S.TRANSL: If we are wearing rags,

S.FORM: uri masan zepzepan itjen.
ori masan zepzepan itjen.
S.TRANSL: we will become infamous.

S.FORM: nu mavanavanaw itjen, sika saqetjuqetju aya.
no mavanavanaw itjen, sika saqetjoqetjo aya.
S.TRANSL: If we are bathing, it is said to be a sign of illness.
